intro: Barringtonia novae-hiberniae, commonly known as the New Ireland banyan, is a tropical tree native to the island of New Ireland in the Bismarck Archipelago. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, pendulous flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree produces a unique fruit with a fibrous, spongy interior that contains numerous seeds. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in humid, tropical climates. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various local wildlife species.
